## Literature research

Consider writing one paragraph to introduce your PhD topic to a scientific audience. Do a brief online literature research and find three scientific articles that you would use to write this paragraph. As part of this literature research, do the following:

### Part 1

1.  Open Zotero
2.  Under Groups, right-click 'ost-hs23' \> New Collection ...
3.  Use your GitHub username as the name for the collection
4.  Hit OK

### Part 2

1.  Open the browser for which you installed the Zotero Connector (if you did not yet install the Zotero Connector, head back to the [pre-course work for Zotero](https://ost-hs23.github.io/website/0-2-pre-work/03-zotero.html#install-the-zotero-connector-for-your-browser))

2.  Open the web pages that show the three scientific articles you want to store in your bibliography. Try to open the original page of the publisher (e.g. ["My Flight Arrives at 5 am, Can You Pick Me Up?": The Gatekeeping Burden of the African Academic](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/13696815.2021.1884972)).

3.  Find your Zotero Connector Add-on. It's often placed in the top right of your browser.

::: {.callout-caution collapse="true"}
## Zotero Connector for Safari users

Zotero Connector for Safari is bundled with the Zotero 6 desktop app.

See here how to activate it: <https://www.zotero.org/support/kb/safari_compatibility>
:::

4. Click on the Zotero Connector icon. If a dialogue opens, click Got it.

5. Click on the Zotero Connector again. The item has changed, it now looks like a paper. 


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](images/screenshot-zotero-connector.png){width=170}
:::
:::


6. The scientific article is stored as a reference your Zotero app and sorted into the Collection that you have selected.

7. Repeat this process for the other two articles that you selected.

### Part 3

1. Head back to the Zotero app
2. Right-click your Collection
3. Click Export Collection
4. Under 'Format', select Better BibTeX
5. Keep all checkboxes unselected (see @fig-export)
6. Save the exported .bib file to a local folder of your choice

::: {.callout-important collapse="true"}
## Better BibTeX format not available?
If the Better BibTeX format is not available for you, head back to the pre-course work assignment for Zotero and setup the Add-on:

<https://ost-hs23.github.io/website/0-2-pre-work/03-zotero.html#setup-add-ons-and-the-citation-key-format>

:::
